User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user account within the FaustApp application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user account.

passwordHash.description: Hashed password for authentication. (Note: actual password storage is handled externally)

registrationCode.description: Registration code used during account creation.

emailVerified.description: Indicates whether the user's email address has been verified.

MemberProfile.title: MemberProfile
MemberProfile.description: Represents the profile information of a member, extending the base user information.

id.description: Unique identifier for the member profile.

location.description: Location or address of the member.

position.description: Playing position of the member (e.g., Abwehr, Spiel, Angriff).

gender.description: Gender of the member (e.g., male, female, diverse).

definition.description: Stores user authentication and registration data. Accessible only by the authenticated user (path-based ownership).

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier of the user, matching the Firebase Auth UID.

definition.description: Stores member profile data, separate from authentication information. All members can be listed, but editing is restricted.

params.name: memberProfileId
params.description: The unique identifier for the member profile.

firestore.reasoning:
This Firestore structure prioritizes authorization independence and QAPs. The primary design decision is to segregate user data and member profiles. User authentication details (`users/{userId}`) are separated from member profile data (`member_profiles/{memberProfileId}`). This structure ensures clarity, simplifies security rules, and avoids hierarchical dependencies.

*   **Authorization Independence:** No `get()` calls are needed in rules. User data and profile data can be secured based on the `request.auth.uid` without needing to read related documents.
*   **QAPs:** Segregation allows secure `list` operations on each collection. For example, you can securely list all member profiles or only the current user's profile without exposing private user data.
*   **Ownership**: `/users/{userId}` path-based ownership ensures that only the authenticated user has access to their own user document.
*   **Predictable Schema:** Ensures a standard and consistent data structure for easier development and debugging.
